The Remotion.Web.UI namespace provides classes related the and generic user interface features.
Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0 (WCAG 1.0)
The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0 defined by the Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI) include a list of checkpoints which must be met by a web page claiming WCAG 1.0 conformance. These checkpoints have one of three priority levels assigned.
The WCAG conformance of a web page is meassured by its conformence level:
Conformance Level Requirement
Conformance Level "A" All Priority 1 checkpoints are satisfied.
Conformance Level "Double-A" All Priority 1 and 2 checkpoints are satisfied.
Conformance Level "Triple-A" All Priority 1, 2, and 3 checkpoints are satisfied.
A web application implemented with the use of the Remotion web controls can enforce WCAG 1.0 level A conformance. This feature is activated by setting the wcag entry in the configuration file. This entry maps to an instance of the type. (See the documentation of Remotion.Web.Configuration.WebConfiguration for details on using the configuration file.)
It remains the developer's responsibility to ensure conformance with all checkpoints related to inter-control relationships and the web application's content itself.
A list of WCAG conform controls can be found in the and namespace documentation.
